args.content:
import Mathlib

/-! Exercise 1.26 (Shakarchi).

Suppose f is continuous in a region Œ©. Prove that any two primitives of f (if they exist)
differ by a constant.

We formalize this for functions on ‚ÑÇ: if F and G have the same derivative f at every
point of a connected set Œ©, then F - G is constant on Œ©. -/

theorem Shakarchi_exercise_1_26 {Œ© : Set ‚ÑÇ} (hconn : IsConnected Œ©)
  {f F G : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ}
  (hF : ‚àÄ z ‚àà Œ©, HasDerivAt F (f z) z)
  (hG : ‚àÄ z ‚àà Œ©, HasDerivAt G (f z) z) :
  ‚àÉ c : ‚ÑÇ, ‚àÄ z ‚àà Œ©, F z - G z = c := by
  sorry
